summary: This document is an email chain from July 28, 2019, detailing complaints and observations regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's conditions in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It reports his complaints about long attorney meetings, inadequate meals, a malfunctioning toilet, and physical symptoms like numbness in his arm and neck. It also notes he was being taken off Psych Observation.

events.title: Epstein's Jail Conditions Complaints
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein complains about his conditions in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), including being in attorney conferences from 8 AM to 8 PM, receiving only one meal (a sandwich at 4:15 PM), a toilet that ran for 45 minutes the previous night, and physical symptoms of numbness in his right arm and neck.

events.title: Epstein Taken Off Psych Observation

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York (implied location of inmate detention)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein complained of being in attorney conferences from approximately 8 AM to 8 PM each day while in custody.
Epstein stated he received only one meal on July 27, 2019—a sandwich at about 4:15 PM—and believed he should be getting lunch and dinner.
A toilet in Epstein's cell reportedly ran for 45 minutes the night of July 27-28, 2019, which he found so aversive and disorienting that he began urinating in a cup to avoid it.
Epstein reported physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm (unable to make a fist) and numbness on his neck, which were assessed by a nurse.
As of the morning of July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was being taken off Psych Observation, with his Suicide Watch status listed as 'None'.
